intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis pteroglossa, commonly known as the feather-lip orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, epiphytic orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers with distinctive, feather-like lips. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, loose potting media. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts.
